SEARCH
Module com.example.nouveau
Package com.example.nouveau

Class Maze

java.lang.Object
com.example.nouveau.Maze
public class Maze extends Object
The class Maze represents a maze composed of cells. It provides methods for generating the maze using Kruskal's algorithm, checking if the maze is perfect, and manipulating the walls of the cells.

  • Constructor Details

    • Maze

      public Maze(int width, int height)
      Constructor for the Maze class. Initializes the maze with the given width and height. Each cell is represented by a Case object.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the maze (number of columns).
      height - The height of the maze (number of rows).

  • Method Details

    • getHeight

    • getWidth

    • KruskalGeneration

      public LinkedList<int[]> KruskalGeneration(int seed)
      Generates a perfect maze using Kruskal's algorithm. The algorithm randomly selects walls and removes them to create passages between cells. As to not create cycles, it uses a union-find data structure to keep track of connected components.
      Parameters:
      seed - The seed for the random number generator (for reproducibility).
      Returns:
      A list of walls that were removed to create the maze.
